descriptions.description: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).

summaries.summary: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).

descriptions.description: Runs a function on items in the array while that function is returning true. It returns true if the function returns true for every item it could visit. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function on items in the array while that function is returning true.

descriptions.description: Runs a function on items in the array while that function is returning true. It returns true if the function returns true for every item it could visit. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function on items in the array while that function is returning true.

descriptions.description: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns an array of all items for which the function returns true. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns an array of all items for which the function returns true.

descriptions.description: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns an array of all items for which the function returns true. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns an array of all items for which the function returns true.

descriptions.description: Runs a function (callback) on every item in the array. The callback function is invoked only for indexes of the array which have assigned values. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function (callback) on every item in the array.

descriptions.description: Runs a function (callback) on every item in the array. The callback function is invoked only for indexes of the array which have assigned values. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function (callback) on every item in the array.

descriptions.description: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

summaries.summary: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

descriptions.description: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

summaries.summary: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

descriptions.description: Checks whether an object is an array or not.

summaries.summary: Checks whether an object is an array or not.

descriptions.description: Puts all elements in the array into a string, separating each element with the specified delimiter

summaries.summary: Puts all elements in the array into a string, separating each element with the specified delimiter

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var jwords = words.join(";");

descriptions.description: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present. The array is searched backwards, starting at fromIndex.

summaries.summary: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

descriptions.description: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present. The array is searched backwards, starting at fromIndex.

summaries.summary: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

descriptions.description: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns the results in an array. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns the results in an array.

descriptions.description: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns the results in an array. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns the results in an array.

descriptions.description: Pops the last string off the array and returns it.

summaries.summary: Pops the last string off the array and returns it.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var lastword = words.pop();

descriptions.description: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.

summaries.summary: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.

descriptions.description: Puts array elements in reverse order.

summaries.summary: Puts array elements in reverse order.

descriptions.description: Decreases array element size by one by shifting the first element off the array and returning it.

summaries.summary: Decreases array element size by one by shifting the first element off the array and returning it.

descriptions.description: The slice method creates a new array from a selected section of an array.

summaries.summary: The slice method creates a new array from a selected section of an array.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.slice(3, 5);

descriptions.description: The slice method creates a new array from a selected section of an array.

summaries.summary: The slice method creates a new array from a selected section of an array.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.slice(3, 5);

descriptions.description: Runs a function on items in the array while that function returns false. It returns true if the function returns true for any item it could visit. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function on items in the array while that function returns false.

descriptions.description: Runs a function on items in the array while that function returns false. It returns true if the function returns true for any item it could visit. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.

summaries.summary: Runs a function on items in the array while that function returns false.

descriptions.description: Sorts the array elements in dictionary order or using a compare function passed to the method.

summaries.summary: Sorts the array elements in dictionary order or using a compare function passed to the method.

descriptions.description: Sorts the array elements in dictionary order or using a compare function passed to the method.

summaries.summary: Sorts the array elements in dictionary order or using a compare function passed to the method.

descriptions.description: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.

summaries.summary: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.splice(3, 2, "done", "On");

descriptions.description: Use the current date and time to create an instance of the object date.

summaries.summary: Use the current date and time to create an instance of the object date.

descriptions.description: Create instance of date. The argument is the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

summaries.summary: Create instance of date.

descriptions.description: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

summaries.summary: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

samples.sample: var date = new Date(year, month, day);

descriptions.description: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

summaries.summary: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

samples.sample: var date = new Date(year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds);

descriptions.description: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

summaries.summary: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

samples.sample: var date = new Date(year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds)

descriptions.description: Use the date specified by the string to create the instance of the date object. String format is "month day, year hours:minutes:seconds".

summaries.summary: Use the date specified by the string to create the instance of the date object.

descriptions.description: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.

summaries.summary: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.

samples.sample: // The number of milliseconds in the first minute after 1970 January 1st. application.output(Date.UTC(1970, 00, 01, 00, 01, 00, 00)); // prints: 60000.0

parameter.name: year
parameter.description: A year after 1900.

parameter.name: month
parameter.description: A number between 0 and 11.

descriptions.description: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.

summaries.summary: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.

samples.sample: // The number of milliseconds in the first minute after 1970 January 1st. application.output(Date.UTC(1970, 00, 01, 00, 01, 00, 00)); // prints: 60000.0

parameter.name: year
parameter.description: A year after 1900.

parameter.name: month
parameter.description: A number between 0 and 11.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: A number between 1 and 31.

descriptions.description: Specifies the function that creates an object's prototype.

descriptions.description: Applies the method of another object in the context of a different object (the calling object); arguments can be passed as an Array object.

summaries.summary: Applies the method of another object in the context of a different object (the calling object); arguments can be passed as an Array object.

descriptions.description: Creates a new function which, when called, itself calls this function in the context of the provided value, with a given sequence of arguments preceding any provided when the new function was called.

summaries.summary: Creates a new function which, when called, itself calls this function in the context of the provided value, with a given sequence of arguments preceding any provided when the new function was called.

descriptions.description: Calls (executes) a method of another object in the context of a different object (the calling object); arguments can be passed as they are.

summaries.summary: Calls (executes) a method of another object in the context of a different object (the calling object); arguments can be passed as they are.

descriptions.description: Returns a string representing the source code of the function. Overrides the Object.toString method.

summaries.summary: Returns a string representing the source code of the function.

summaries.summary: The value undefined.

summaries.summary: Encodes a URI by replacing certain characters with escape sequences.

descriptions.description: Encodes a URI component by replacing all special characters with their corresponding UTF-8 escape sequences.

summaries.summary: Encodes a URI component by replacing all special characters with their corresponding UTF-8 escape sequences.

function.name: escape

descriptions.description: Returns the hexadecimal encoding of a given string.

summaries.summary: Returns the hexadecimal encoding of a given string.

function.deprecated: Not needed anymore, use native javascript methods (escape(string)).

descriptions.description: Evaluates JavaScript code passed as a string. Returns the value returned by the evaluated code.

summaries.summary: Evaluates JavaScript code passed as a string.

descriptions.description: Returns true if the given number is a finite number.

summaries.summary: Returns true if the given number is a finite number.

samples.sample: application.output(isFinite(1)); // prints: true application.output(isFinite(Infinity)); // prints: false application.output(isFinite(isNaN)); // prints: false

descriptions.description: The NaN property indicates that a value is 'Not a Number'.

summaries.summary: The NaN property indicates that a value is 'Not a Number'.

descriptions.description: Returns true if the given name can be used as a valid name for an XML element or attribute.

summaries.summary: Returns true if the given name can be used as a valid name for an XML element or attribute.

samples.sample: application.output(isXMLName("good_name")); // prints: true application.output(isXMLName("bad name")); // because of the space, prints: false

descriptions.description: Makes a floating point number from the starting numbers in a given string.

summaries.summary: Makes a floating point number from the starting numbers in a given string.

descriptions.description: Makes a integer from the starting numbers in a given string in the base specified.

descriptions.description: Makes a integer from the starting numbers in a given string in the base specified.

summaries.summary: Makes a integer from the starting numbers in a given string in the base specified.

function.name: unescape

descriptions.description: Returns the ASCII encoding of a string that was previously encoded with escape or another similar routine.

summaries.summary: Returns the ASCII encoding of a string that was previously encoded with escape or another similar routine.

function.deprecated: Not needed anymore, use native javascript methods (unescape(string)).

descriptions.description: Returns the string representation behind a given object.

summaries.summary: Returns the string representation behind a given object.

samples.sample: application.output(uneval(isNaN)); // prints something like: function isNaN() { [native code for isNaN, arity=1] }

descriptions.description: Parses a string as JSON and returns the parsed value.

summaries.summary: Parses a string as JSON and returns the parsed value.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The string to parse as JSON. See the JSON object for a description of JSON syntax.

descriptions.description: Parses a string as JSON and returns the parsed value.

summaries.summary: Parses a string as JSON and returns the parsed value.

samples.sample: var transformed = JSON.parse('{"p": 5}', function(k, v) { if (k === "") return v; return v * 2; });

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The string to parse as JSON. See the JSON object for a description of JSON syntax.

parameter.name: reviver
parameter.description: A function, prescribes how the value originally produced by parsing is transformed, before being returned.

descriptions.description: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified

summaries.summary: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to convert to a JSON string.

descriptions.description: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified. As a function, the replacer takes two parameters, the key and the value being stringified. Initially it gets called with an empty key representing the object being stringified, and it then gets called for each property on the object or array being stringified.

summaries.summary: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to convert to a JSON string.

parameter.name: replacer
parameter.description: If a function, transforms values and properties encountered while stringifying; if an array (of String or Number), specifies the set of properties included in objects in the final string.

descriptions.description: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified. As a function, the replacer takes two parameters, the key and the value being stringified. Initially it gets called with an empty key representing the object being stringified, and it then gets called for each property on the object or array being stringified.

summaries.summary: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to convert to a JSON string.

parameter.name: replacer
parameter.description: If a function, transforms values and properties encountered while stringifying; if an array (of String or Number), specifies the set of properties included in objects in the final string.

parameter.name: space
parameter.description: The space argument may be used to control spacing in the final string (causes the resulting string to be pretty-printed). If it is a number, successive levels in the stringification will each be indented by this many space characters (up to 10). If it is a string, successive levels will indented by this string (or the first ten characters of it).

descriptions.description: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified. As a function, the replacer takes two parameters, the key and the value being stringified. Initially it gets called with an empty key representing the object being stringified, and it then gets called for each property on the object or array being stringified.

summaries.summary: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified.

descriptions.description: Returns the type of the given object, one of these strings get returned: "number", "string", "boolean", "object", "function" or undefined if the object doesn't exists.

summaries.summary: Returns the type of the given object, one of these strings get returned: "number", "string", "boolean", "object", "function" or undefined if the object doesn't exists.

samples.sample: application.output(typeof "abc"); // string application.output(typeof 10); // number application.output(typeof 10.1); // number application.output(typeof true); // boolean application.output(typeof parseInt); // function application.output(typeof application); // object application.output(typeof somethingInexisting); // undefined

descriptions.description:
Provides a statement with an identifier that you can refer to using a break or continue statement.
For example, you can use a label to identify a loop, and then use the break or continue statements to indicate whether a program should interrupt the loop or continue its execution.

descriptions.description: If set to true, then toString() and toXMLString() methods will normalize the output to achieve a uniform appearance.

descriptions.description: Takes one argument which can be a string with a namespace URI or a Namespace object and adds the argument to the in scope namespaces of this XML object.

summaries.summary: Takes one argument which can be a string with a namespace URI or a Namespace object and adds the argument to the in scope namespaces of this XML object.

descriptions.description: Appends a new child at the end of this XML object's properties, the changed XML object is then returned.

descriptions.description: Takes a single argument with the attribute name and returns an XMLList with attributes matching the argument.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with children matching the property name.

descriptions.description: If the XML object has no parent then the special number NaN is returned, otherwise the ordinal position the object has in the context of its parent is returned.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with the child nodes of this XML object.

summaries.summary: Returns false for XML objects of node kind 'text', 'attribute', 'comment', and 'processing-instruction'.

descriptions.description: Returns true if the XML object the method is called on has a property of that name.

summaries.summary: Returns true if the XML object the method is called on has a property of that name.

descriptions.description: Returns true for XML objects of node kind text or attribute. For XML objects of node kind element it returns true if the element has no child elements and false otherwise. For other node kinds (comment, processing instruction) the method always returns false.

summaries.summary: Returns true for XML objects of node kind text or attribute.

descriptions.description: Returns an array of Namespace objects representing the namespace that are in scope for this XML object.

summaries.summary: Returns an array of Namespace objects representing the namespace that are in scope for this XML object.

descriptions.description: Takes two arguments, an existing child to insert after and the new child to be inserted. If the first argument is null then the second argument is inserted as the first child of this XML.

summaries.summary: Takes two arguments, an existing child to insert after and the new child to be inserted.

descriptions.description: Takes two arguments, an existing child to insert before and the new child to be inserted. If the first argument is null then the child is inserted as the last child.

summaries.summary: Takes two arguments, an existing child to insert before and the new child to be inserted.

descriptions.description: This always returns 1. This is done to blur the distinction between an XML object and an XMLList containing exactly one value.

summaries.summary: This always returns 1.

descriptions.description: returns the local name part if the XML object has a name.

summaries.summary: returns the local name part if the XML object has a name.

descriptions.description: Returns the qualified name (a QName object) of the XML object it is called

summaries.summary: Returns the qualified name (a QName object) of the XML object it is called

descriptions.description: If no argument is passed to the method then it returns the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object. If a prefix is passed to the method then it looks for a matching namespace in the in scope namespace of this XML object and returns it when found, otherwise undefined is returned.

summaries.summary: If no argument is passed to the method then it returns the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object.

descriptions.description: If no argument is passed to the method then it returns the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object. If a prefix is passed to the method then it looks for a matching namespace in the in scope namespace of this XML object and returns it when found, otherwise undefined is returned.

summaries.summary: If no argument is passed to the method then it returns the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object.

descriptions.description: Returns an array with the namespace declarations associated with the XML object it is called on.

summaries.summary: Returns an array with the namespace declarations associated with the XML object it is called on.

descriptions.description: Returns a string denoting the kind of node this XML object represents. Possible values: 'element', 'attribute', 'text', 'comment', 'processing-instruction'.

summaries.summary: Returns a string denoting the kind of node this XML object represents.

descriptions.description: Returns this XML object after normalizing all text content.

summaries.summary: Returns this XML object after normalizing all text content.

descriptions.description: Returns the parent XML object of this XML object or null if there is no parent.

summaries.summary: Returns the parent XML object of this XML object or null if there is no parent.

descriptions.description: Iinserts the given value as the first child of the XML object and returns the XML object.

summaries.summary: Iinserts the given value as the first child of the XML object and returns the XML object.

descriptions.description: If no argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all the children of the XML object which are processing instructions. If an argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all children of the XML object which are processing instructions where the name matches the argument.

summaries.summary: If no argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all the children of the XML object which are processing instructions.

descriptions.description: If no argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all the children of the XML object which are processing instructions. If an argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all children of the XML object which are processing instructions where the name matches the argument.

summaries.summary: If no argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all the children of the XML object which are processing instructions.

descriptions.description: Returns true if the property name is '0' and false otherwise.

summaries.summary: Returns true if the property name is '0' and false otherwise.

descriptions.description: Removes the namespace from the in scope namespaces of this XML object if the namespace is not used for the qualified name of the object or its attributes.

summaries.summary: Removes the namespace from the in scope namespaces of this XML object if the namespace is not used for the qualified name of the object or its attributes.

descriptions.description: Takes two arguments, the property name of the property / properties to be replaced, and the value to replace the properties.

summaries.summary: Takes two arguments, the property name of the property / properties to be replaced, and the value to replace the properties.

descriptions.description: Replaces all children of the XML object with this value. The method returns the XML object it is called on.

summaries.summary: Replaces all children of the XML object with this value.

descriptions.description: Changes the local name of this XML object to the name passed in.

summaries.summary: Changes the local name of this XML object to the name passed in.

descriptions.description: Replaces the name of this XML object with the name passed in.

summaries.summary: Replaces the name of this XML object with the name passed in.

descriptions.description: Changes the namespace associated with the name of this XML object to the new namespace.

summaries.summary: Changes the namespace associated with the name of this XML object to the new namespace.

descriptions.description: Allows the global XML settings to be adjusted or restored to their default values.

summaries.summary: Allows the global XML settings to be adjusted or restored to their default values.

descriptions.description: Allows the global XML settings to be adjusted or restored to their default values.

summaries.summary: Allows the global XML settings to be adjusted or restored to their default values.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.description: The new settings that should be applied globally to the XML object.

descriptions.description: Returns an object containing the global XML settings.

summaries.summary: Returns an object containing the global XML settings.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with all the children of this XML object that represent text nodes.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList with all the children of this XML object that represent text nodes.

descriptions.description: Returns a convenient string value of this XML object.

summaries.summary: Returns a convenient string value of this XML object.

descriptions.description: Returns a string with the serialized XML markup for this XML object. XML.prettyPrinting and XML.prettyIndent settings affect the returned string.

summaries.summary: Returns a string with the serialized XML markup for this XML object.

descriptions.description: The method simply returns the XML object it is called on.

summaries.summary: The method simply returns the XML object it is called on.

descriptions.description: It calls the method attribute of each object in this XMLList and returns the results in order in an XMLList.

summaries.summary: It calls the method attribute of each object in this XMLList and returns the results in order in an XMLList.

descriptions.description: Calls the method attributes of each object in this XMLList and returns an XMLList with the results in order.

summaries.summary: Calls the method attributes of each object in this XMLList and returns an XMLList with the results in order.

descriptions.description: Calls the method child of each XML object in this XMLList object to return an XMLList with the matching children in order.

summaries.summary: Calls the method child of each XML object in this XMLList object to return an XMLList with the matching children in order.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with the children of all XML objects in this XMLList.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList with the children of all XML objects in this XMLList.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with all the comment child nodes of XML objects in this XMLList in order.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList with all the comment child nodes of XML objects in this XMLList in order.

descriptions.description: Returns true if there is (at least) one XML object in the list that compares equal to the value

summaries.summary: Returns true if there is (at least) one XML object in the list that compares equal to the value

descriptions.description: Returns a deep copy of the XMLList it is called on.

summaries.summary: Returns a deep copy of the XMLList it is called on.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with all of the matching descendants of all XML objects.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList with all of the matching descendants of all XML objects.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with all of the matching descendants of all XML objects.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList with all of the matching descendants of all XML objects.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with the matching element children of all XML objects in this XMLList.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList with the matching element children of all XML objects in this XMLList.

descriptions.description: Returns true if the XMLList contains exactly one XML object which has complex content or if the XMLList contains several XML objects.

summaries.summary: Returns true if the XMLList contains exactly one XML object which has complex content or if the XMLList contains several XML objects.

descriptions.description: Returns true if the XMLList object has a property of that name and false otherwise.

summaries.summary: Returns true if the XMLList object has a property of that name and false otherwise.

descriptions.description: Returns true if the XMLList is empty or contains exactly one XML object which has simple content or contains no elements at all.

summaries.summary: Returns true if the XMLList is empty or contains exactly one XML object which has simple content or contains no elements at all.

descriptions.description: Returns the number of XML objects this XMLList contains.

summaries.summary: Returns the number of XML objects this XMLList contains.

descriptions.description: Returns the XMLList object it is called on after joining adjacent text nodes and removing empty text nodes.

summaries.summary: Returns the XMLList object it is called on after joining adjacent text nodes and removing empty text nodes.

descriptions.description: Returns the common parent of all XML objects in this XMLList if all those objects have the same parent.

summaries.summary: Returns the common parent of all XML objects in this XMLList if all those objects have the same parent.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with all the matching processing instruction child nodes of all XML objects in this XMLList.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList with all the matching processing instruction child nodes of all XML objects in this XMLList.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList with all the matching processing instruction child nodes of all XML objects in this XMLList.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList with all the matching processing instruction child nodes of all XML objects in this XMLList.

descriptions.description: Returns true if the property name converted to a number is greater than or equal to 0 and less than the length of this XMLList.

summaries.summary: Returns true if the property name converted to a number is greater than or equal to 0 and less than the length of this XMLList.

descriptions.description: Returns an XMLList containing all the text child nodes of all the XML objects contained in this XMLList.

summaries.summary: Returns an XMLList containing all the text child nodes of all the XML objects contained in this XMLList.

descriptions.description: Returns a string representation of the XMLList

summaries.summary: Returns a string representation of the XMLList

descriptions.description: Returns the concatenation of toXMLString called on each XML object. The result for each XML object is put on a separate line if XML.prettyPrinting is true.

summaries.summary: Returns the concatenation of toXMLString called on each XML object.

descriptions.description: Simply returns the XMLList object it is called on.

summaries.summary: Simply returns the XMLList object it is called on.
